function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The e-commerce website now shows the shopping cart overlay closed, revealing the main page with the product listing again. The page lists various Samsung smartphones like Galaxy S10 5G (already in the cart), Galaxy S10+, Galaxy S10, and Galaxy S10e, each with an 'add to cart' button. The navigation bar contains a shopping cart icon indicating 1 item in the cart. The goal is to test the shopping cart's functionality by adding multiple different items and testing quantity adjustments.","explanation":"Now that the overlay is closed, add the Galaxy S10+ to the cart to see how the system handles multiple distinct products in the cart. This will test if the cart correctly updates to reflect the addition of a new product. Click on the 'add to cart' button for the Galaxy S10+.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"2:r4:"}}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.
Here are some examples how the 'emulate_interaction' function should be used.
Please test my website: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description": "The start page of a web site with multiple calculators for different purposes. There are buttons to navigate to the differet calculators and a button to switch the language of the web site. The current language is English.", "new_testing_goal": "Test the calculator for calculating the area of a circle in multiple languages.", "explanation": "First navigate to the calculator for the area of a circle. Then input a radius and calculate the area. Switch the language of the web site and repeat the process.", "interaction": {"interaction_type": "click", "element_id": "btn-area-circle"}}

messages.content: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website appears to be an e-commerce store, specifically for Samsung smartphones. The main components include a navigation bar offering categories like Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series; a Hero section advertising the Samsung Store with a 'Shop now' button, and a Products section featuring items such as Galaxy S10 5G, Galaxy S10+, Galaxy S10, and Galaxy S10e, each with an 'add to cart' button. There's also a shopping cart icon in the navigation bar indicating the number of items in the cart, which currently shows zero.","new_testing_goal":"Explore the functionality of the shopping cart by adding multiple items to it and checking if the cart updates correctly.","explanation":"First, add a Galaxy S10 5G to the cart by clicking its 'add to cart' button. This should increment the number of items indicated on the cart icon in the navigation bar.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"1:r4:"}}

messages.name: emulate_interaction
messages.content: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"After adding a Galaxy S10 5G to the cart, the website now shows that the cart has 1 item. The products section features Galaxy S10 5G, Galaxy S10+, Galaxy S10, and Galaxy S10e, each with an 'add to cart' button. The Galaxy S10 5G now shows 'in cart' instead of 'add to cart'. There's also a cart icon in the navigation bar showing the number of items in the cart (1). Clicking on the cart icon reveals an overlay with the cart contents: Galaxy S10 5G is listed with the option to increase quantity, decrease quantity, or remove the item. The cart also shows the total cost and options to clear the cart or checkout.","new_testing_goal":"Add different items to the cart to see how it handles multiple products, and test the functionality of updating item quantities.","explanation":"First, add a Galaxy S10+ to the cart. This will test how the cart updates when multiple different products are added. Click on the 'add to cart' button for the Galaxy S10+.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"2:r4:"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website now features an overlay shopping cart that shows the Galaxy S10 5G as added to the cart, including options to increase or decrease its quantity or remove it. There is also an option to clear the cart or proceed to checkout. Likely, the attempt to add the Galaxy S10+ to the cart was blocked because the shopping cart overlay was active, thus making the 'add to cart' button for the Galaxy S10+ inaccessible.","explanation":"To proceed with adding another item to the cart, the shopping cart overlay needs to be closed first. This will make the 'add to cart' buttons for the other products accessible again.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":ra:"}}

The user provided the following end instructions: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases.
Pursue your self-assigned sub-goal or assign a new one: Explore the functionality of the shopping cart by adding multiple items to it and checking if the cart updates correctly..
Previously executed interactions by goal: {"Explore the functionality of the shopping cart by adding multiple items to it and checking if the cart updates correctly.": 2}.

Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.
Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: 1:r4:, 2:r4:, 3:r4:, 4:r4:, :r1:, :r2:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with
